pkgmetadata.longdescription: PerlJammer is a network-controllable MP3 jukebox using a Perl/Tk interface, backed by a SQL database and designed to be used with a shared music library. It generates random playlists on demand, plays using a user-selected external MP3 player app (default: media-sound/madplay), supports individual exclusion lists for up to 256 different users and per-track gain control, allows drag-and-drop resorting of the playlist, and allows interactively linking songs to always be selected as a group. It includes a network mini-remote with several interface options, including vertical and horizontal toolbars and a skinnable virtual remote. A variety of helper tools are also included.
